name: Architecture Compliance
description: Evaluation rubric for architecture compliance (SuperCore v2.0)

levels.10: Perfect layer placement, no circular dependencies, clean separation
levels.8-9: Correct layer placement, minor dependency issues

examples.excellent: Layer 1 (Or√°culo) only depends on Layer 0 (Dados), Layer 2 (Objetos) depends on 0-1
examples.poor: Layer 5 (Frontend) directly accessing Layer 0 (Database), skipping layers

levels.8-9: Mostly compliant, minor deviations with justification
levels.6-7: Some compliance, deviations without clear justification

examples.excellent: Uses PostgreSQL as primary DB (ADR-002), FastAPI for APIs (ADR-003)
examples.poor: Introduces MongoDB without ADR, uses custom auth instead of Keycloak (ADR-005)

levels.8-9: Mostly uses approved stack, minor additions justified

examples.excellent: Go/Python backend, React/Next.js frontend, PostgreSQL, Redis, NebulaGraph
examples.poor: Introduces Java/Spring Boot, MySQL, Angular without discussion

levels.10: Comprehensive ADRs, detailed diagrams, complete design docs
levels.8-9: Good ADRs, adequate diagrams, basic design docs

examples.excellent: ADR with Context/Decision/Consequences, C4 diagrams, sequence diagrams
examples.poor: No ADR, whiteboard photo, no design doc
